title: Lombrigueira (Chenopodium ambrosioides)
body: Indigenous Chenopodiaceae, also known as formigueira, very common both in Madeira and Porto Santo. It has sinuate-toothed or nearly entire leaves, with a strong and distinctive smell, which are a very effective vermifuge medicine that Madeirans sometimes use as an emmenagogue.

Madeira: Island belonging to the Madeira archipelago
Porto Santo: Island belonging to the Madeira archipelago
